alert.note: Alert for Blount; Cocke; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 8:25AM CST until January 09 at 12:30PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Blount County in east Tennessee... Southern Cocke County in east Tennessee... Southern Sevier County in east Tennessee... * Until 130 PM EST. * At 925 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Gatlinburg, Pittman Center, Townsend, Elkmont, Great Smoky Mountains National Park and Roundtop Mountain State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
